comments.text:
2ppl, monday lunchtime, dir. Clifden.

Right after we walked to the intersection, a car stopped and took us to Clifden. Intersections like these are really nice I think, since the cars have to slow down, making it easier for them to stop and take you.
You'll be gone in no time in any direction. Heading to Galway, the quicker way might be to head north towards Maam Cross and then take the main road.
Good spot lots of room to pull over !
We got a lift in 15 min to Ennis from here (we were going to Galway). There is a bus bay which is quite long so the cars can stop easily.
Super sweet old couple picked us up on their way to Galway on Sunday morning around 11am
There is a lay-by here, but really anywhere along this road is safe to stop cars. We waited around 10 minutes for a lift to Clifden.
It does really work here !

Great place to go to either Limerick city, M18 Ennis/Galway or M7 Dublin. A sign might help because drivers might be going in any one of the 3 directions. Its almost the last stop before the motorway starts.
On the main road to Limerick, between the bus stop and the tourist office.
it was really friendly grandmother

2ppl, Tuesday evening, dir. Mulranny.

Almost dark, hitched at the exit from the gas station.

2ppl, Tuesday afternoon, direction Mallaranny.

Made sense to try after the roundabout and it worked well.

2ppl, tuesday morning, direction north.

Many cars passing, but it took us 15 mins to get a lift to Letterfrack. Okayish spot, but not ideal since it is after the bend.

2ppl, Sunday afternoon. Initially wanted to go to Killarney, stood with a KERRY sign (county Kerry). But we got the ride to Galway instead, and we didn't regret. 

Good spot for several directions. Cars can go quite fast already, so having a big sign is a good idea.

2ppl, wednesday evening, direction Limerick. We decided to get dropped off here, since our driver was only going to Naas. We found a ride immediately, asking the first van driver. Probably very lucky us, but it seemed nevertheless like a good spot. Moderate traffic.

2ppl, wednesday afternoon. We came from Dundalk, wanting to get a ride towards Limerick. Our strategy was to find a ride from someone going past Dublin to Red Cow (a Luas stop, on the west side of Dublin), take the Luas and then continue from there hitchhiking west to Limerick.

The strategy worked quite well, as we found that person really soon. We asked around at the entrance of the station.
2ppl, wednesday afternoon, direction Dublin. Big service station in the direction of Dublin. Stood at the exit with the sign.
2ppl, wednesday afternoon, direction Dublin. Found a ride quite shortly to the next service station south from here. We found this roundabout to be much safer spot than the other one on the ramp.
2ppl, tuesday evening. We found a ride immediately towards Northern Ireland. We asked people on the gas station.
Perks include shade trees, slower speeds, long space to stop, and good visibility.
Good spot. Cars can pull over. Thumbing works very well all over Donegal and I got an easy lift to Carndonagh
After the bus stop there is space to Park it's great
Next to the gaz station it's really good, we waited for 1 minute and a guy took us to camp
If you‘re hitchhiking from Mountshannon, this is the best spot to Scarrif, Ennis. It’s a long parking lane or emergency lane and I never had to wait more than a few cars
There is a long emergency lane so I just put my hand out and of of the next cars stopped. They are all very keen to help you.
There is a petrolstation with toilets and all that food stuff. Really kind people around there! A truck driver took me to Dublin.

Went the whole way from the lake to Ennis in the morning on a weekday and I changed cars twice but never had to wait more than a few seconds. In this whole region hitchhiking is really culturally integrated, amazing friendly people.

yup west galway
loads of space, fair amount of traffic going into galway
The first people I asked where heading towards past Killarney so I was very lucky! But a good place to ask around, lots of traffic!
People just drive off from the roundabout and there’s a hard shoulder to pull over to.
Not a bad place, room for cars to pullover. Had a shadow as well.

don't listen to the other spots, this is THE BEST hitching spot to go to Dublin

small space to pull over before roundabout: walk few metres before that and sign from there, very busy sunday mid-day
space to pull over, very busy on Saturday, strawberry booth nearby but very expensive
very busy, loads of room to pull over, everyone here is going to Wexford
good for lifts to the south-east coast, space to pull over, good visibility, busy road on early Saturday morning
hitched from here a good few times, never waiting more than 20 minutes for a ride to Galway or Clare. can ask for rides from the rest stop but can easily just thumb a ride from the on slip.
Good spot, people go slow so they can see you better, we got a lift to the start of carrauntoohill trail by an irish granny.

I got really lucky to get a ride this far. Although people stoped for me often enough all over the island, they usually were locals and not intending to drive out of Achill. During tourism season you might get more rides out.

Autumn 2023
the green just in front of the cafe is a good spot for hitching towards Dublin, one lift often gets you as far as Kilmacanogue where public transport can be got...
I waited a lot for Ireland, but it did work.
A bit long to go there from the city center. But I really think this is the best place to Galway.
Great petrol station for Galawy, etc
Excellent spot, my average waiting time has been about 5 minutes. You can walk here from the city centre (20-30 mins)
Many cars past me, got some funny looks from pedestrians,  but I enjoy it, especially happy for the few kids that seen it works when I got picked up..
Very good place to escape from Dublin towards Wicklow Mountains. Our route: Dublin>Saggart>Blessington>Hollywood>Glendalough

Petrol station for Blessington

It's easy to get there from the City Center by Luas Red Line towards Saggart and then on foot for a while.

Another option: catch Dublin bus nr 65 to stop nr 2576 - Citywest Road, Blessington Road

I must of hitched this route upwards of 30 times in last six years...
I walk out of town as far as this garage as it is an easy place for cars to see form far away and have room to pull in... 
also I stand at the exit of garage cause often drivers pulling out pick up, they have had time to think about it and get a good look at me/have a relaxed chat before deciding...
If I were heading to Glendelough I would take lift as far as Hollywood as a lot of traffic passing through going all the way t
Try ask somebody for a lift here, it's excellent spot
Blessington petrol station.
good
got a ride seconds after i put my thumb out. friendly faces and plenty of traffic, good spot for anywhere on the m4

2ppl, Tuesday afternoon, direction Westport.

Quickly found a ride to Leenaun. The driver invited us for the dinner in the hotel as well. Super generous!
Many cars, many commuters. And if, for some strange reason, you don't get picked up, there is an amazing hostel just up the hill from the main junction - the Old Monastery Hostel!
-> Galway city. Good place to stand if you are going into Galway city, rather than on the dual carriageway, if you get a lift as far as Oranmore.
west galway is filled with angels. only good rides going out connemara. got a lift even late in the day directly where we wanted to go.
got a ride here once to Maam's Cross
Good place to hitch if you want to go in direction of Spiddal, or Connemara by the coast road. You can take a bus, to get closer, or it's one hour walking from galway city center.
Took a while to get a lift
After Maxol Station on Limerick Road, wait near bus stop as Its easy for cars to pull in there. Only had to wait 10 minutes

We were 2 to hitchike for tralee. People often stoped to proposed a lift but rarely as far as tralee so best advice is to get a lift to anascaul then hitch to tralee from there. Super duper friendly and nice.
Slightly further up the road outside the football pitch, for Tralee or Killarney.
great for rides to limerick, weekday midday got a ride in no time

Good place to go to Limerick. 
Unfortunately, cars go very fast, but there is lot of place for stopping.

There is a gaz station here. Perfect for direction West (Mullingar, Athlone, Galway).
Bus Stop No. 2201. Lucan Road, Palmerstown Drive. Bus 25, 26, 66, 67.
traffic to dublin and east in general, good visibility and space to pull over
After the roundabout and the Aldi there is loads of space for drivers to stop. they don't drive that fast. easy to get short rides
good spot! only con is cars are going quite fast, but great visibility, all the ppl going east from Sligo pass through here, space to pull over
Roundabout outside Summerhill College.
Great if heading to Mallow or Cork. Petrol station now open, but cheaper places to shop in charleville.
There is a closed petrol station what is a very good place for cars to stop. It was getting dark but got a lift in 20 minutes to Mallow.
Got to tralee in 1 ride. Had to wait a while but not too long. Cars can stop easily and people are super friendly, there's just not so much traffic.
I think this place is better for hitching to Tralee than using the spot outside Moran's garage on the N86.
Outside the Dingle Brewery (Crean's) on the Conor Pass road to Tralee ... its a bit awkward for cars to pull in.

if youre leaving tuam (direction galway) from this roundabout then hitch on the N83 exit instead of the motorway entrance. cars are more likely to stop for you along this road than the motorway, and its generally safer and youre more likely to get a lift quicker. i got a ride here in two minutes in the middle of november even though it was almost dark.

caught a lift straight to ennis early monday morning. anywhere on the oranmore bypass is good but this spot will catch all the traffic leaving town and its right after a roundabout so cars are slowed  :-)

2ppl, monday morning, dir. Clifden.

Low traffic, so it was not a problem for the car to stop on the road. The car took us just a bit up north. Nice but expensive cafe close to the spot, to charge batterries.
pretty much every car going direct to galway uses this road - also good for rides to ballinrobe, headford etc.
Good spot with visibility and room to pull over. Cars are going a bit fast.
One of the first really good spots south of Dublin to hitch south. Could be better with more long distance traffic.

The ferry from Buncrana to Rathmullan is hitchable. It is paid by car and you can easiely talk to the cars waiting for the ferry. The ferry goes every hour, but can only take roundabout 20 cars. But you will probably find someone to take you.

cutest ride w a dog on my lap I was in heaven and life was great,
petrol station buzz, not that much traffic took us (2ppl) 20mins or so to get a ride, good visibility, space to pull over
People are coming from boyle and can see your sign quite good, the others on the N4 are driving quite fast but you still got quite some space for them to Park and you to be safe
Good spot, space to Park, a lot of cars are passing by without stopping because it's just before the roundabout but we got a lift to Limerick!
mostly local drivers, busy crossroads at least at the weekends though, so bound to get a good lift sooner or later. with a sign maybe eady to get a lift to roscommon quicker
good for rides to athlone, got lucky w a lift to galway but lots of south going local drivers. tried thumbing first but got a lift soon after we made a sign for athlone
loads of space to pull over, most traffic local but few cars going to longford (maybe further)
busy, guy asked us if we want a ride as soon as he saw our sign
Many cars past me, got some funny looks from pedestrians,  but I enjoy it, especially happy for the few kids that seen it works when I got picked up..
usually this spot is good but on a sunday in august it was slow getting a ride west.
good spot for rides to kinnegad and mullingar, on weekdays havent been able to get a lift further than west meath but maybe worth trying at weekends
Motorway exits for Western Ireland and Dublin
Not the best spot for people to pull in but lots of cars passing by !
I got a ride right here from the airport and then it didn't take long to get all the way to Galway.

Went to carrauntoohill hike with my girlfriend, irish people from the zone seems to dislike hitchhikers, we got help from a french couple, the spot is fine, a lot of traffic and many parts where cars can stop.

There is a cutout, where cars can stop well and where you are still seen by the drivers from a distance. Direction Fossa, Killorglin or Dingle. I always hitch there to the Killarney Youth Hostel, just 5 km further (before Fossa). It takes me a bit longer than hitching into Killarney, however it works well. About 10-15min waiting time.
Nobody goes outside the city here. Go more on east.
Direction East or South to Dublin or Limerick, Cork. This street is part of inner city bypass and there's quite often traffic jam. Perfect spot, just make a sign.
I know the area, this is not really a good hitching spot unless you are heading up in Dublin mountains
For Cork, Limerick etc. Please wait ask all at the service station.
The spot is good. Enough space for the cars to stop. The traffic is not so busy but you will definitely get a lift to the way to Cork.
Stand after bridge for Cork, etc.
